Let X be a smooth projective curve of genus g, and let C be a smooth projective curve of genus h, such that C intersects X transversely at n distinct points. Compute the dimension of the vector space of global sections of the sheaf Intersection Cohomology complex of X with coefficients in the sheaf of rational functions on C. 

In other words, find the value of  $$\dim H^0(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C)$$ where $IC_X$ denotes the intersection cohomology complex of $X$ and $\mathcal{O}_C$ the sheaf of regular functions on $C$ .
message_2:
To compute the dimension of the vector space of global sections of the sheaf Intersection Cohomology complex of X with coefficients in the sheaf of rational functions on C, we will use the following formula:

$$\dim H^0(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) = \chi(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C)$$

where $\chi$ denotes the Euler characteristic. We can compute the Euler characteristic using the Riemann-Roch theorem for the tensor product of two sheaves:

$$\chi(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) = \deg(IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) + \chi(X, \mathcal{O}_X)$$

Now, we need to compute the degree of the tensor product of the sheaves $IC_X$ and $\mathcal{O}_C$. Since $X$ and $C$ intersect transversely at $n$ distinct points, we have:

$$\deg(IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) = \deg(IC_X) + \deg(\mathcal{O}_C) = n$$

Next, we need to compute the Euler characteristic of the structure sheaf $\mathcal{O}_X$. This can be done using the genus formula:

$$\chi(X, \mathcal{O}_X) = 1 - g$$

where $g$ is the genus of the curve $X$. Now, we can plug these values back into the Riemann-Roch formula:

$$\dim H^0(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) = n + (1 - g) = n - g + 1$$

So the dimension of the vector space of global sections of the sheaf Intersection Cohomology complex of $X$ with coefficients in the sheaf of rational functions on $C$ is given by:

$$\dim H^0(X, IC_X \otimes \mathcal{O}_C) = n - g + 1$$
